item.title: When is Nintendo Wrapped 2025 Coming Out? Expected Release Date & How To Check Stats
item.content:encoded:
It’s been one of the biggest years for Nintendo in a while with the release of the Switch 2. With two different Nintendo consoles to play games on, and another stellar line of new releases added to the catalog, your Nintendo Wrapped Year in Review for 2025 should make for interesting reading.

Nintendo will be back with the 2025 Year in Review. This gives you a comprehensive rundown of all the games you’ve played this year, how many hours you sank into each, the types of games you played, and how many Blue Shells you’ve fired (the last one might be a slight exaggeration).

Nintendo Year in Review 2025 Expected Release Date

Sometime in the third week of December—starting December 15—is when everyone should expect the 2025 Nintendo Year in Review.

Sony seems to be the only company deadset on retaining a consistent Wrapped schedule! Xbox is all over the place, but we can get a rough idea, and Nintendo’s is also a haphazard do-whatever launch.

Nintendo’s 2022 Wrapped was on Tuesday, December 13. This seems quite normal, right? The 2023 stat wrap-up dropped on Friday, December 15. Lastly, the 2024 Nintendo Year in Review arrived before Christmas on Wednesday, December 18.

From this, we can see that Nintendo isn’t attached to a certain day of the week, nor a date. However, the most consistent aspects are that the Nintendo Wrapped always arrives a few days after PlayStation and Xbox, and it’s commonly in the third week of the month.

As of writing, you can presumably look forward to your Year in Review becoming available between December 15 and December 19. Insider Gaming will update this if something drastically changes, and Nintendo shocks everyone.

How To Check Nintendo Wrapped 2025 Stats

If the method is the same, all you need to do to check your Nintendo 2025 Year in Review stats is to click the 2025 link once it’s live, log into your Nintendo account, and check out your stats.

Once you’ve done all of this, a plethora of numbers and facts await, and you can question your life choices and whether you need to get out more.

Stat comparisons are always fun. Don’t be afraid to share your end-of-year Nintendo stats with the rest of the IG community, which you can do via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

There are many other Wrapped and Year in Review stats to check if you’re on different platforms, so please check out IG’s guides for Spotify Wrapped 2025, PlayStation Wrapped 2025, Xbox Wrapped 2025, and Fortnite Wrapped 2025.

item.title: Fortnite’s Next Big Anime Collaboration for Chapter 7 Season 1 Has Leaked
item.content:encoded:
A reliable source has leaked that Fortnite’s next big anime collaboration is with Bleach, and it’s set to arrive this season.

Fortnite has had several notable anime collaborations in the past, with big names like Naruto, Dragon Ball Z, Jujutsu Kaisen, and more coming to the island. What’s more, we already have one member of the Big 3 anime in the game; a second is set to be added shortly.

Fortnite Bleach Collaboration is Expected to Arrive This Season

The collab between Fortnite and Bleach was spotted by SamLeakss and corroborated by HYPEX on X (formerly Twitter). HYPEX’s new post also revealed that the collaboration will include the song “Number One – Bankai”, the iconic soundtrack that has played several times during crucial moments in the series.

We still don’t know the details about what other content the Bleach x Fortnite collab will bring. If we go by the previous collaborations, then players can expect some new cosmetics for sure, and Bleach has a solid roster of characters, with some popular ones being Ichigo, Kenpachi, Byakuya, Kisuke Urahara, Aizen, Uryū, Yhwach, and more.

On top of that, most anime collaborations have introduced special abilities to the game. Dragon Ball Z introduced the Kamehameha, My Hero Academia brought Deku’s Smash and Todoroki’s Ice Wall, and Jujutsu Kaisen introduced Hollow Purple and the Straw Doll technique. With Bleach’s iconic Bankai song being added, we could get the Bankai ability, with players having to find their own Zanpakutōs on the island. However, this is just speculation.

In other news, here’s how you can view and share your Fortnite Wrapped 2025 stats. Additionally, here’s what you need to know about Fortnite OG Chapter 1 Season 7 release date and content. What are your thoughts on Fortnite getting a Bleach collaboration? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about PlayStation Plus December 2025 Game Catalog headliners leaking online. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Geometry Dash Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Geometry Dash monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Diamonds, Mana Orbs and other cosmetics. 

Does a combination of the PC classic, Dave and Guitar Hero sound like a fun experience to you? If so, you need to check out the exhilarating experience that is Geometry Dash immediately. Geometry Dash is a popular platformer where syncing your movements to the music is of utmost importance. Players are required to guide an icon from one end of the map to the other, all while maintaining the rhythm and avoiding obstacles and other distractions. The game auto-scrolls to the side, meaning that the amount of time players have to make decisions is also quite limited. 

There are 26 distinct levels that come standard in Geometry Dash, with each level having its own unique soundtrack. Another feature that makes Geometry Dash so popular among its players is the level editor. This allows users to create their own custom maps for the game, with the added bonus of being able to select the soundtrack for each level. For players looking to customise their gameplay experience by changing the player icon, there are vaults where this can be done – The Vault, The Wraith Vault, The Vault Of Secrets and The Chamber Of Time. This article provides players with all of the active Geometry Dash codes for each of these vaults. 

Active The Vault Codes In Geometry Dash

How To Redeem The Vault Codes In Geometry Dash

To unlock the Vault in Geometry Dash, players need to first collect 10 Silver User Coins. Once this is done, here are the steps to be followed to redeem the Vault codes:

  1. Launch the game and click on the settings icon at the bottom.
  2. Click on the open lock icon on the top right of the screen to access the Vault.
  3. Input one of the active codes into the box under where it says “What are you poking around for?”
  4. If the code entered is correct and still active, you will receive your reward. 

Active The Wraith Vault Codes In Geometry Dash

How To Redeem The Wraith Vault Codes In Geometry Dash

Here’s a step-by-step guide to redeeming codes in the Wraith Vault in Geometry Dash:

  1. Launch the game and go into the main levels screen.
  2. Scroll and select the level called ‘The Tower’.
  3. In the tower, click on the icon resembling a face in the bottom right to open the Wraith Vault.
  4. Input one of the active codes into the text box. 
  5. If the code is correct and still active, your reward will be granted. 

All Active Vault Of Secrets Codes In Geometry Dash

How To Redeem Vault Of Secrets Codes In Geometry Dash

Players need to collect 50 Diamonds to gain access to the Vault Of Secrets. Once that’s done, follow this step-by-step guide to redeem Vault Of Secrets codes In Geometry Dash:

  1. Launch the game and click on the Icon in the main menu.
  2. Click on the Unclocked icon on the top right of the screen and choose the Vault Of Secrets.
  3. Input one of the active codes into the text box. 
  4. If the code is entered correctly and still active, you will receive your reward. 

Active Chamber Of Time Codes In Geometry Dash

How To Redeem Chamber Of Time Codes In Geometry Dash

Players need to complete the secret challenge inside the Vault Of Secrets to enter the Chamber Of Time in Geometry Dash. Here’s a detailed step-by-step guide to that:

  1. Go to The Vault of Secrets and type “The Challenge” into the text box. This will start a new level in the game that costs 200 Diamonds to enter.
  2. Once you have completed the level, click on the door icon on the bottom right of the screen. 
  3. Go into the basement and find the locked demon, who will ask you to unlock the door for him. 
  4. Tap on all three of the keyholes to activate them.
  5. Now, go to the ‘Coming Soon!’ section of the game’s main selection page and click on the ‘i’ icon.
  6. This will reveal a door. Once inside, interact with the gatekeeper. 
  7. Once that’s done, go back to the Vault Of Secrets and press the button, but make sure you have 500 Diamonds. 
  8. Upon pressing the button, you will reach an area with a green rope. 
  9. Click on the rope to access the secret shop and purchase the Master Emblem. 
  10. Now, head back to the ‘Coming Soon!’ section to open the door and enter the third chamber. 
  11. Once inside, input the active codes as usual and claim your prizes. 

Do check out our Roblox code guides, such as Build an Island, Grow a Business, and Grow a Garden codes. Also, check out the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: PlayStation Plus December 2025 Game Catalog Headliners Leak Early
item.content:encoded:
A new leak by a reliable source reveals the headliners for PlayStation Plus December 2025 Game Catalog additions, and it includes Assassin’s Creed Mirage and one more title.

We already know the free monthly PlayStation Plus games for December, including LEGO Horizon Adventures, Killing Floor 3, and more. All players are now waiting for the last additions to the game catalog for the 2025 calendar year, and thanks to a new leak, we know 2 of those games.

Assassin’s Creed Mirage and Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty Coming to PlayStation Plus in December

The latest leak about PlayStation Plus’s December Game Catalog titles comes from a Dealabs report. The report reveals that Assassin’s Creed Mirage and Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty will be added to PlayStation Plus Game Catalog on December 16, 2025. Moreover, it seems that Soulcalibur III could be the new title for PlayStation Plus Premium/Deluxe members. The official announcement of PS Plus Game Catalog titles for December 2025 is expected on December 10 at 5:30 PM (French time).

For those unaware, Assassin’s Creed Mirage recently received a brand new DLC called Valley of Memory, which added 6 hours of additional content for players to check out, along with several noticeable gameplay improvements. Additionally, the developers recently announced that the title has reached 10 million players and will reach even more with its addition to PlayStation Plus.

In other news, PlayStation Wrapped 2025 is out, and here’s how you can access it. Additionally, Tencent has agreed to pause the promotion of Light of Motiram as the Horizon clone lawsuit with Sony continues. What are your thoughts on the two leaked headlines for PlayStation Plus December Game Catalog? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimensions DLC, making it easier to claim the Shiny Charm. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
